direction.raw_text: Do you have any idea what it's been like around here for the past four days?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She could have at least given us a phone number or the name of someone to contact...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (surprised) I don't get it. Didn't they tell you we were gonna be here today?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure they told us! So what? That doesn't make the last four days any less hellish than they were!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, anyway, they're here now, that's all that matters! Peter turns and walks toward the basket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The next bottle's in 45 minutes. I made it already. It's in the basket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bottle?   Whadda ya mean, bottle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About an hour after her bottle, she starts yawning. Put her to bed right away or it's pure hell for the next three hours, at least that's what we've noticed. Peter has returned with the basket. The Punks look at the baby, their eyes wide with disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell is that?   A baby?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sarcastic) No, it's a very short teenager. Of course it's a baby! Now listen carefully: I'm giving you a can of the milk she's been getting. She loves it, and more importantly,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . she's not allergic to it. I even put a can of the same brand in here for you, but in powdered form, understand? Punk #1 hears "powder" and catches on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh! I get it!      Powdered milk! Very clever!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, right... real clever... Okay, here. She's all yours. Good luck. He hands them the basket.    Punk #1 grabs the handles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, I got it. You can take her out now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take what out?     I'm not taking anything out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a minute, I don't get it! We take the basket and the milk, that's all. We ain't gonna take the... what's inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whadda ya mean, what's inside?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You take it all, man!    It's a package deal!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what are we s'posed to do with it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do I know? You take it where they told you to take it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'mean, I take it to the connection?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, whatever you want to call it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure that's the plan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bet that's the plan! We're not keeping her one more second.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, if that's the plan... He passes the basket to Punk #2
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Here, hold this. Okay, so long! They start to leave, pressing the elevator button.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (suddenly a little worried) Uh... listen... maybe you could leave us the address or the phone number just in case. So we can find out how she's doing? The Punks exchange a puzzled glance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yeah, sure, the address. (feebly searching his pockets) Oh shit, I don't have it on me... But I'll call you. Okay, so long!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So long! The elevator has arrived.    The Punks quickly slip inside it with the basket. Michael closes the door. Peter plops down in the armchair by the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aah, relief at last!    Good riddance!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said it! Now maybe I can get some work done. He disappears in the direction of his room. Peter is sitting    on something hard. He pulls it out from under him, it's    a package. He looks at it, casually reading: "Care     of Jack Collins." He tosses it to the side. Suddenly,     it dawns on him. He leaps up, grabs the package and    runs into Michael's room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 58   INT. MICHAEL'S ROOM - DAY                               58 PETER (holding the package) What the hell is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, a package, I guess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was this package delivered to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, why? Peter raises his voice, exasperated by Michael's calm attitude.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When the hell did this package arrive?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you quit shouting!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When did this fucking package fucking arrive, Michael?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know... Oh yeah, Sunday -- Mrs. Razzolini brought it up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy shit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the package those guys came for, not the baby, you asshole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, asshole yourself!... Oh shit! Peter nods and begins to bark orders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look out the window and see if you see them, I'm gonna try to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . catch up with them... Michael runs to the window. Peter runs like a madman through the apartment out the front door. He presses the button for the elevator. It's in use.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddamit! He opens the door leading to the stairs and races down them, holding on to the bannister. He flies, overwhelmed by anxiety. Suddenly he trips, loses his balance and makes a spectacular crash landing. The package gets a bit crushed, and little individual packets of white powder spill out of it. Peter stares at them in horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell is this? He picks up a few packets and examines them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, God, no... dope!    That's all we need! He starts to tremble  with fear. He picks the packets up as fast as he can and  hastily puts them back into what's left of the package;  then shoves it all into his pocket and continues racing  down the stairs. 59   EXT. STREET - DAY                                           59 Punk #1 is attempting to strap the basket onto the motorcycle with a bungie cord. Punk #2 watches him coolly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'd be better off taking the subway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to ride the subway with a hundred grand in uncut dope, go ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well we can't ride around carrying this baby basket.    We'll get stopped by the cops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So go ahead, take the subway and stop bothering me. I'm going to hook this onto the back seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll never hold, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (desperately going at the hook and the basket) Goddamn hook! Christ, what a stupid idea hiding the shit with this kid. It's ridiculous! Peter comes rushing out of the building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (huffing and puffing) Oh, thank God, you're still here! There's been a terrible mistake. That wasn't the package you were s'posed to take. It was another one. I have it right here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean? What other package?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll take the basket back and give you the other package, here. No mistake. Peter takes the package from his pocket and is about to grab the basket. Punk #1 pushes him back violently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ain't takin' nothin' back, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I'm tellin you it was a mistake...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in a low but very aggressive tone) You tryin' to double-cross us or something? Beat it before I get pissed, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (panic-stricken, in an equally low tone) But I'm telling you, I've got your package right here. There's been a mistake...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A mistake my ass! Now get outa here, man, or I'm gonna stick this right in your gut. He discreetly reveals a switchblade knife he's carrying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Punk #2) Start the bike. Punk #2 is about to get on the motorcycle.   Peter stops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I'm telling you, I've got the real package in my pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Punk #1) Watch it, the cops! Peter quickly puts back the package in his pocket. A patrol car comes up next to them, right beside the car in which Graton is sitting, taking in every bit of the action.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to his partner) Terrific! I bet these morons screw up everything. One of the COPS gets out of his car and comes over to the Punks and Peter. Peter is scared stiff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispering) If you called the cops on us, pal, you're a dead man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, what's that doing on the back of the bike? No one answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wouldn't by any chance be intending to drive with a baby basket on your motorcycle, would you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course not, Officer. We'd never do something like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So why did you strap it on in the first place if you had no intention of driving with it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So it wouldn't fall off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very funny. As he speaks, Peter undoes the bungie cord from around the basket and takes it off the motorcycle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, really, Officer, they weren't gonna drive off with it -- They were just watching it for me while I was doing a quick errand. (to the Punks) Thanks, guys. Punk #1 gives him a dirty look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, let's see some identification, everybody. The punks exchange a glance.   Suddenly Punk #1 shouts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go! They take off running in different directions. Cop #1 charges after Punk #1 and yells to his partner who's still in the car:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch the guy with the basket! Cop #2 leaps out of the car, gun in hand. Peter stiffens with fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freeze! All right, asshole, let's see some I.D.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (urbanely) Listen, Officer, let's stay calm now. I haven't the slightest intention of running. I am not a criminal. I'm an architect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calming down
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . a little) Your I.D., let's see it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm terribly sorry, Officer, but I don't have any identification on me. I just came down with my baby to run a quick errand. I haven't committed any crime.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, let's go, in the car. I'm taking you down to the station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, c'mon, that's impossible -- you see I have a baby. I have to give her a bottle in fifteen minutes, I can't go anywhere. I live right in this building -- let me go up to my apartment and I'll get you my license immediately... You can even come with me if you like...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, lead the way. They disappear inside the building. Peter is carrying the basket in his left hand; his right hand is clenched on the horrible package hidden in his pocket. Just then Cop #1 comes running back, empty-handed. Graton gets out of his car and comes up to Cop #1, show- ing him his badge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (angry) Inspector Graton, Narcotics. It just so happens I was tailing those two guys and now because of you clowns I lost them, probably forever. Thanks a lot!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could we know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget it. Listen, your partner went in here with the guy and the baby. He lives up on the tenth floor. I can't go in because if he sees me, my cover is blown. So could you please try not to lose this one, okay? He's someone who's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . gotta be watched very closely. I've called for backup and it's on its way. 60   INT. APARTMENT - DAY                                      60 The elevator doors open, Peter and Cop #2 exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is it. Please come in... can I get you a cup of coffee or something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No thanks.   I'll just wait out here. Peter enters the apartment and calmly crosses through the house, carrying the basket. As soon as he's out of the cop's sight, he starts running like a madman down the corridor. He runs into Michael who was just coming to meet him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, what's happening? What were those cops doing... Peter shuts him up, grabs him roughly under the arm and leads him into his room, closing the door behind them. Peter speaks softly but he's totally freaking out, he can hardly breathe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Michael... Michael... we're in deep trouble. The package... The package...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?   What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a cop on the doorstep... He didn't see you... He mustn't see you... We're in deep trouble, Michael...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me what...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The package  they came for wasn't the baby, it  was dope, drugs, a shitload of  dope! We were stopped by some cops  down on the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But did the cops see the dope?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's right here. He takes out the package.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll get twenty years if the cops find this on us! Climb down the fire escape and hide it... anywhere! Michael takes the package, opens the window and starts to climb out it when Peter stops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, whatever you do,   don't lose the goddamn dope, we   gotta be able to return it to   those dealers or we're dead. Those    guys are serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry. He starts down the fire escape, then stops and turns back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, by the way, I put some water up to boil for her bottle. Michael disappears. Peter picks up Mary, grabs his  wal- let and leaves the room. When he gets to the hall,  he discovers that Cop #1 has joined Cop #2, to whom he is whispering something. Peter holds his license out  for them to see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's my license.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid I'm going to have to ask you to remain in the apartment. The narcotics squad will be arriving any moment now. They want to ask you a few questions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Narcotics squad? What do they want with me? I don't even use aspirin!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 61   INT. SUPERMARKET - DAY                                     61 Michael is buying a pair of scissors, glue and a roll of Scotch tape. Then he buys a box of large diapers -- he chooses the ones that come in a box. Michael leaves the supermarket, whistling. 62   EXT. PARK - DAY                                            62 Michael is sitting on a bench facing the grass, with his back to us, he seems quite busy. As we CLOSE IN, we discover that he has opened the box of diapers and that he's holding one of them; its plastic has been carefully cut out with scissors. Casually, glancing right and left, he takes the individ- ual packets of white powder out of his pocket and shoves them into a little plastic bag from the supermarket. Then he carefully tapes the bag so it's well-sealed and flattened out, and he inserts it into the diaper, be- tween the plastic and the absorbent fabric. Next, the diaper is taped up, folded back up and put back in the box, neatly packed between the other ones. Michael closes the box again and glues it together so it looks as if it's never been opened. He throws all the other stuff away in a trash can and grabs hold of his brand-new box of diapers. He walks away. 63   INT. APARTMENT - DAY                                       63 Michael comes into the living room with his box of diapers and a bag of groceries. In addition to the two cops there are now THREE NARCOTIC AGENTS who are interrogating Peter. He is holding Mary. The basket is on an armchair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Officers... What's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, Michael, it's nothing serious, just a little misunderstanding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you give her the 5:30 bottle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I just gave it to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you change her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, she's soaking wet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, I'll do it. Michael puts down his bag of groceries, takes Mary from Peter and disappears with the box of diapers. In his room, he lays Mary down on his bed and starts undressing her. 64   INT. LIVING ROOM - DAY                                    64 AGENT #1 And who's he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's my roommate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I see, I see...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you don't see. There are three of us sharing this place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, three, huh? A regular 'mirage a trois'!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's 'menage'... and it's not. We all have lots of girlfriends, thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-huh, so what's your friend do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a cartoonist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the other guy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a pilot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah-hah... Now that's interesting... (to his colleague)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ... Get me those photographs, the ones taken at Newark Airport. Agent #1 looks in his attache case.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So does this friend of yours ever fly to South America?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.   Never.   Only North America. The PHONE RINGS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you object if I answered it for you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not at all, go right ahead.    I've got nothing to hide. Agent #1 picks up the phone and listens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a collect call    from a Jack Collins in La Paz,    Bolivia. That wouldn't happen to    be your pilot friend, would it?     The one who never goes to South    America?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, it is him. Agent #1 hands him the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, yes, operator, I accept the charges. Agent #1 gestures to Agent #3 to take a look around the apartment. Agent #3 slips away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you mind very much if I listened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, go right ahead. Agent #1 picks up the other telephone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Jack? Fine, yeah. How're you? Yeah, he's fine, too. Yeah, we left a message for you, right... No, it was nothing
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . special, it was just, I mean... to see how you were doing and all ... No, no emergency. Everything's fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said everything's fine! The what?... I don't know what you're talking about... Oh yeah, the package! Yeah, yeah, it got here ... and was picked up, uh-huh. Hey! Why didn't you call sooner? Huh? 'Cause what?... Oh, you're onto something hot -- well, aren't you the lucky one!... So when are you getting married?... Forget it, I was just kidding... Well, everything's fine up here. So have a good time. See you in a couple of weeks. 'Bye. Peter hangs up.   So does Agent #1.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now that's interesting. So you wanna tell me about this package and the hot something-or-other your friend lucked onto... in La Paz... Bolivia... South America? Peter sits down, stunned. 65   INT. MICHAEL'S ROOM - DAY                                  65 Mary is lying on Michael's bed. He has just finished putting a regular diaper on her. Then Michael looks for the tampered-with diaper in the box. He finds it, checks that it is well-sealed, and places it under Mary's bottom. Just then Agent #3 appears in the doorway. Michael calmly finishes putting the dope-filled diaper on the baby on top of the other one. MARY is COOING. Every- thing appears normal. However, a trained eye might be very surprised by the enormous thickness of the diaper covering the young lady's backside. But a narcotics agent is not necessarily the most qualified person to notice something odd like this. Agent #3 silently observes Michael, who gives him a big smile as he slips on Mary's pajama bottoms. Michael picks Mary up and for the first time talks to her in the kind of silly babytalk used by adoring parents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okey-dokey, honeybunch, it's time to go beddy-bye now... We're gonna take a nice long nappy-wappy... He goes back to the living room, followed by Agent #3. Agent #1 is in the process of showing Peter a photograph.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you recognize anyone in this picture? Peter looks: it's the photo of Jack and Paul that was taken at the beginning of the movie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pointing) Sure.   This is Jack Collins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah?   Now that's interesting. Michael has laid Mary down for a nap in her basket, observed by the five cops. He now sits down, cheerful and bubbling over with enthusiasm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So! Can I get you something to drink? Agent #1 totally ignores him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, who's the baby belong to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Jack's daughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And why are you two taking care of her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because her mother's in Europe for six months, and since Jack had to be away for two weeks, I took my vacation to take care of her, I love kids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, Peter and I just love kids!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now that's interesting. Well, we'll be seeing each other again soon, in fact very soon. In the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . meantime, I'd appreciate it if you didn't leave New York in the next few days. All the cops head for the door. Michael accompanies them, putting on a very urbane act.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come back anytime, gentlemen. You're always welcome here. We have no particular plans to leave New York in the near future, so don't worry about us now. 'Bye now. Once the cops are gone, Michael races back to the living room. Peter has collapsed into his armchair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in a low tone) Christ, what a mess! They'll be on our tails around the clock! How the hell are we gonna get rid of the goddamn dope?! By the way, where is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (also speaking in a low tone) It's cool, don't worry, I got it stashed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where? Michael points to Mary's bottom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This way it's close at hand!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you out of your mind??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relax, will you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I diapered the dope on her right in front of the cop and he never noticed a thing!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told the cops we were taking care of her. You realize we're now stuck with the kid till Jack
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . comes back. There ain't nobody coming to pick her up, and I have to go back to the office today!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a minute. You're not gonna stick me with this kid! Tell them you need a maternity leave, tell them anything, but we've got to go 50-50 on this!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's not all -- we haven't heard from the punks yet either! 66   EXT. STREET - DAY                                     66 Hidden within a parked car, three men are keeping a close watch on the entrance to Peter, Michael and Jack's build- ing. The two uniformed cops emerge, get in their car, and pull away. 67   INT. APARTMENT - DAY                                        67 PETER (on the phone; things are heating up) That's right, you heard right: I'm not coming in to work for two weeks... No, I can't explain why... (in a louder tone) ... Because I can't, that's all!...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: this has nothing to do with chasing ass! Jerry... Jerry! Will you stop screaming for a minute and listen? I'm in trouble, you understand? Deep trouble... I know... I know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Goddammit, Jerry, of course winning the competition is important to me! The firm's my whole life if you must know. No, no, please -- don't send anyone over here... Don't you come either. No, Jerry... Okay, listen, I'll be there in a half-hour, but I can't stay long. No! Don't come here! I'll be right over. He hangs up.   Michael enters the room, with his coat on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta go over to    Mr. Oxman's -- he just called and    he's freaking out. He says if I     don't bring some cartoons over    now, the deal's off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but don't worry about it, I'll be back before it's time for her next bottle. She's asleep now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terrific, just terrific! Jerry just called: I have to go to the office right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, call him back. Tell him you'll come later.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no way. I can't, he's suicidal. Why don't you call Oxman and tell him you'll be there in a few hours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're crazy. Oxman is leaving in an hour. If I don't meet him before then, I blow my 15,000 dollar contract.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh shit, I can't take this anymore!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, maybe we could pawn her off on Mrs. Razzolini, just for a couple of hours -- she's crazy about her!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good idea!    Let's go. 68   INT. BUILDING - DUSK                                  68 Peter and Michael get out of the elevator on Mrs. Razzolini's floor. They each are holding one of the handles on the basket. They are walking quickly. Suddenly Michael stops Peter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait -- I hear someone... I'll go see... Peter waits with the basket.   Michael tiptoes to the corner of the corridor. At the very end of the corridor, on Mrs. Razzolini's doorstep, he sees the three narcotics Agents talking with Mrs. Razzolini. We can hear snippets of their conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I brought a package up to them... I think it was last Sunday...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are these people like? What kind of lifestyle do they have? Michael hastily returns to Peter, still on tiptoes. He leads him back to the elevator and pushes the elevator button.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispering) Just as I thought -- the goddamn cops are grilling Mrs. Razzolini.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh shit! We sure as hell can't hand her the baby with an ass full of dope... right in front of the narcs! The elevator has arrived meanwhile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (breaking down) What should we do? I really gotta go...
direction.name: direction

Peter stands there speechless for a moment, then an awful thought crosses his mind. He runs like crazy into his room -- the basket's not there. Stepping over the debris and all the things strewn over the floor, he rushes into the living room, then into Michael's room. The basket's nowhere to be seen. Peter runs all over, back and forth ten times in all the rooms. Tears are flowing from his eyes. Suddenly, he hears FAINT CRIES.   They're coming from the back bathroom. Sophia, a glass of champagne in her hand, is yakking away nonstop, like a real motor-mouth. Michael, silent, is doodling on a paper napkin. His pen is making little squares and circles; the circles come together and start looking like a baby lying in a crib. Sophia is absorbed in her monologue. Suddenly Michael realizes what he has drawn. He crumples the napkin and throws it in the wastebasket. Sophia hasn't noticed anything. Michael is bored stiff. 130   INT. APARTMENT - NIGHT                                  130 Peter comes home with Natalie.   They take off their coats. They look tired.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my feet are killing me! She takes off her shoes and collapses in the armchair in the hall. There is a LOUD SQUEAKING noise. She reaches underneath her and brings out a rubber giraffe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell is this? Oh, it's a giraffe... (tosses it away and walks off) ... Oh, by the way, have you
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . heard anything about that kid, you know, the one you had here for a while? Peter stares at the giraffe, horrified. He feels the tears coming to his eyes. Grabbing the giraffe, he hurls it with all his might against the wall. 131   INT. PLANE - DAY                                       131 Jack's in his plane, at the controls, waiting for takeoff. He's daydreaming. His CO-PILOT comes in and joins him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, what's the matter with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whadda you mean, what's the matter with me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sick?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me?   No.   I'm fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon, Jack! Didn't you see who we've got on board today?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure I did, why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... look...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So it's the Rockettes, so what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you're just sitting there like that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whaddaya mean, sitting there? I happen to be getting ready to fly this airplane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, forget it. 132   INT. APARTMENT - DAY                                   132 128. Jack, alone in his room, with his back to us, is facing his full-length mirror. He's looking at himself, with one fist on his hip and the other hand clutching a half-empty bottle of scotch. He observes himself and slowly turns around -- we can now see him in profile. His hair is disheveled, he's unshaven, and he's put a pillow underneath his sweater. He's pregnant. He takes a big swig of scotch. The DOORBELL RINGS. Jack walks away from the mirror. He staggers dead drunk. But dignified, pregnant. Jack opens the door. Standing there is Graton holding a stuffed animal, a rabbit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (out of it) Hi?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you recognize me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in a total fog) Wait... uh, no...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm the one who was tailing you... Remember, in the park...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yeah, the park... the diaper and all...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it, the diaper... But don't worry. This isn't an investigation, I left the force four months ago, and anyway, they've arrested the whole gang since then... I just wanted to ask you something...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you noticed? I'm pregnant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (neutrally) Oh yeah, I see...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, shall we go for a walk?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 133   EXT. RIVERSIDE - DAY                                133 Graton and Jack are sitting on a bench beside the East River. Jack, still pregnant, has brought along his bottle of scotch, and he takes a swig from it occasion- ally. Graton has brought along his rabbit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's something I have to know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wouldn't you like to be pregnant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Oh sure... maybe... no... I dunno... Look, there's been something bothering me for a long time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see, if I was God, and I could create the world all over again, here's what I would do: I would create Adam from Eve's rib, not the other way around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's an interesting idea... Actually, I just wanted to ask you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At least that way things would have been clearer to begin with, y'see. They wouldn't have made us believe that somebody could come out of our rib, y'know? 'Cause nothing ever comes out of our rib, y'know? Ever. Only out of our prick, and even then ... Everything still has to be done after that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's for sure...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What we men know how to make is planes, buildings, cars, and all that stuff... It's useful, mind
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's driving me crazy! This thing keeps going around and around in my head...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you know what, it's not even like they wanted us to believe it -- it might have been us who wanted to believe it... But let's face it, nobody comes out of our rib...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was the dope in the diaper, yes or no?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still, that's hard to take, goddam it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was it in the diaper, or not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dope?   It was in the diaper, why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, thanks a lot. I feel so much better now. Here, this is a rabbit for your baby. (shakes both Jack's hands) Thanks again, 'bye, I'm so happy. Graton goes off, floating on cloud nine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But wait -- the baby's gone... 134   INT. KITCHEN - MORNING                                  134 Jack and Michael, slumped in their chairs, are having breakfast. It's a gray day. It's POURING out. Peter, bending over a bowl of steaming water, with a towel over his head, is inhaling the steam. When he looks up to speak, we see his swollen tear-streaked
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (extremely, in fact, too playful) Tomorrow, San Francisco!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (grim) Say hello to the Pacific for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (even more playful) I'll be back the day after tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (emerging from the bowl, congested) You'll be id a foul bood -- jet lag really wipes out you dow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (annoyed) Whaddya mean, now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah: you didd't used to give a shit before, but dow it docks you out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (very hostile) Before what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (putting his head back over the bowl) How would I dow? 'Before,' that's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on edge) It doesn't knock me out at all...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there any jam left?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do. Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You eatig here todight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm going to the movies tonight with, uh... damn, I can't remember her name...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'mean the Japanese one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, she's from Finland. Oh damn it. What the hell's her name? They've got such weird names... Magdalena... no, Marianna... no ... oh, I can't remember -- anyway it's Ma-something or other...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary? A sudden, weighty silence ensues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This fuckig cold! I look like I'b cryig all the tibe but I'b dot -- it's just this dab cold. He gets up and goes out. 135   INT. SYLVIA'S STUDIO APARTMENT - NIGHT                  135 Jack, holding a bouquet of flowers and Graton's rabbit, rings the doorbell of an apartment. On the door a card reads "SYLVIA AND MARY." A chubby YOUNG MAN with thick glasses opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.   Is Sylvia in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, she'll be back in a couple of hours -- around midnight, she said...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wanna come in and wait for her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure... Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He follows the Young Man in Sylvia's studio. It's very messy. On the table there's a big heap of books and papers. Mary, sitting on the floor, is wearing a diaper and a sweater, but her legs are bare. She's playing with an empty pack of cigarettes. She looks at Jack with a serious, unruffled expression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sylvia doing okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know -- I'm a med student. I'm just babysitting. I only met her a couple hours ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I see... Silence. The Young Man sits down at the table and immerses himself in his books. Mary doesn't look up from her pack of cigarettes anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, on second thought, I don't think I'll wait for her. Just give her this when she gets back, okay? And this is for the baby. Jack hands the bouquet and the rabbit to the Young Man, who plops them down on a chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, no problem. He immerses himself again in his books. Jack heads toward the door, then turns around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shouldn't the baby be in bed by now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... I don't know... When I put her to bed she cries so I just let her stay up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you have any tights to put on her legs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tights?... Well, it's pretty hot in here anyway...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Jack gets out of there in a hurry. 136   INT. LIVING ROOM - DAY                              136 Jack, in his pilot's uniform, is sitting on the living room couch. Michael is standing before him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want me to call them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you've got to let them know!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm not going anywhere anymore, I've had it with traveling. I quit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon, I'll call you a cab, you've still got time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you call anybody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the plane's s'posed to take off in half an hour -- They won't have time to replace you. This is serious -- you'll lose your job and you won't be able to pay your share of the apartment anymore... you... Jack takes off his pilot's jacket and throws it aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be a dishwasher, I'll live in a flophouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going, I told you; I'm not going ever again. I'm sick and tired of traveling, sick and tired of broads. They all have the same asses and I can't seem to love them anyway. I can't take another hotel room, and swimming pools and trendy restaurants! I want to know
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . what my life's all about. Do you know what your life's about, Michael? Michael has no answer to these questions.     He leaves. 137   INT. APARTMENT - EVENING                                   137 Michael, wearing an apron and holding a wooden spoon, goes into Jack's room. The latter, lying on his bed, is smoking and staring at the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, I made us a good dinner. I bought some filet mignon and Haagen-Dazs butter pecan. When Peter comes back he'll cheer you up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's been here all day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has?    I didn't hear him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's in his room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Michael heads towards Peter's room.    Jack feebly gets up and follows him. Michael knocks on the door.     No answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peter!    Dinner's ready! Still no answer. Michael opens the door:      Peter's lying face-down on his bed. He's holding the rubber giraffe and sobbing. Michael and Jack, dismayed, stare at him. Peter hides his face in his arm. Jack and Michael go to the kitchen and sit down to their steaks, totally depressed. 138   INT. APARTMENT - MORNING                                   138 The DOORBELL RINGS. A bare-chested Michael, in jeans, drags himself over to the front door and opens it. There stands Sylvia with Mary in her stroller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Sylvia is a disheveled mess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is Jack here? 'Cause I'm a mess. I can't handle it, I'm all alone...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shouting towards Jack's room) Jack!   Jack, c'mere for Chrissake!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Cause my place is tiny, y'know, and my schedule's insane -- and I just finished four days of posing and we ended up every day at... Jack, bare-chested, comes in pulling on his jeans. He stops short at the front door. Sylvia is about to cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Jack) Yeah, y'see, Jack, I just did four days of posing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And every day we finished at three in the morning and since Mary always gets up around 5:30...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you can imagine how much sleep I've gotten...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, of course, 'cause after the 5:30 bottle it starts all over again around nine...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And by the time I change her and play with her a little, it's already eight o'clock...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then that's it -- you get only an hour of sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the babysitters till three A.M. -- all my money is sucked
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . down the tubes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plus they don't put the kids to bed, they let them lie around half-naked...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, so the flowers and the rabbit were from you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could have strangled that guy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean it, I can't cope anymore. My parents and I don't talk to each other and anyway they live in Texas, and the baby needs to get out to the park...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, tell me about it! Finding time to take her to the park every day is a real bitch!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I have to work, I need the money to survive and anyway I love my job... A distraught Peter, bare-chested and in jeans, comes running in from his room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But to work I've gotta have a babysitter, and to have a babysitter I need to work, so I run around all day... (she sobs) ... and I'm not sure I'm taking good care of her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course you're taking good care of her -- we know what it's like, don't cry, she looks great...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sobbing) It's just 'cause I haven't slept in four nights -- she must be teething or something, I don't know but I can't manage...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, it's nothing, she's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . cutting a tooth -- you just have to put some stuff on her gums...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She pulled the same thing on us. We lost all our friends in one night -- on account of one tooth!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And just look    at my face! Nobody's going    to want me to model for them    with the way my face looks...    And what'll happen to me if they    don't want me anymore?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you're beautiful -- At your age all you need is a good night's sleep and you'll look like new.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right, a good night's sleep -- but when?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, why don't you leave the baby with us for a few days, till you recuperate... I mean, if you want.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're old pros -- it's not a big deal for us...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (blowing her nose, wiping her eyes) Really? I can leave her with you for a little while?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. Leave her with us. Come back whenever you want. Get some rest. Sylvia, between two sobs, picks up a big bag beside her on the doorstep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I brought a couple of things for her, just for a few days... Michael eagerly takes the bag from her.    It's followed by a second, and then a third.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (taking Mary in his arms) Is she hungry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it's time for her bottle
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (reaching out toward him with the rabbit)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: it's all ready in the bag...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll go heat up some water right away. Would you like a cup of coffee?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, okay, thanks... Peter, carrying Mary towards the kitchen, is followed by Jack and Michael with the bags. Sylvia blows her nose and walks around aimlessly in the hall. In the kitchen the three men bustle about with the bags, the bottle, the saucepan... They've swallowed all their pride and are kissing Mary all over, on her neck, her hands, her tummy. They're deliriously happy. Michael takes some sheets out of the bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll go make up her bed! He exits, and, once in the corridor, prances around, leaping and dancing... He gets to the living room and goes over to the crib: suddenly, he recoils and freezes, a fearful expression on his face. Then he turns and races back to the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (floored) Hey, you guys -- come and see, come and see!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come see, I said. Jack and Peter nervously follow Michael into the living room. They stop short in front of the crib: There is Sylvia, curled up in a fetal position, sucking her thumb and sleeping like an angel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The poor thing, she's really wiped out.
direction.name: direction
